Reviews.Title: “More than your money's worth!”
Reviews.Author: pbocsak
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Rome, and we decided to stay in Pensionato San Paolo for the second time. The staff is nice and helpful, rooms are clean and big enough for two. It's only a few metro stops away from downtown and is located in a safe area. Metro stop is less than 5 minutes away on foot (200m - 600ft.). I'd highly recommend you stay there. Staff also speaks a variety of languages, among which are Italian, French, English and German

Reviews.Title: “Next time in Rome, I'll stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: cloud_traveller
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the Pensionato San Paolo, travelling alone on a business trip. I chose this place just because I was arriving late at night and leaving early in the morning, and it was close to the place I had to go to and to an underground station (which is a plus in Rome). Room and bathroom were small but not tiny, both with a nice window. However, the room was stinking so much that I couldn't sleep: the old carpet smelled of smoke or something like that, and I couldn't breathe. The problem was that you couldn't leave the windows open as there is a huge terrace connecting all the rooms, so anybody could enter. Besides, the bathroom needs a radical renovation and the shower box was so small that I had troubles washing myself (and I'm a young woman, short and thin). Breakfast was not as bad as I expected after such a night, but if you want an espresso and a croissant you have to pay for them and since in Italy everybody drinks espresso rather than American coffee, it's a bit unfair to me. I wouldn't go back to this hotel. I'm sure you can find something better for the same price.

HotelInfo.Name: Pensionato San Paolo
HotelInfo.Address: Viale F. Baldelli 41, 146 Rome, Italy
